description: This file tracks the current status and key milestones of the project, serving as a progress log. It provides a timestamped snapshot of the project's initialization phase and notes on the orchestration setup. This helps stakeholders monitor development stages within the larger system.

This file is an auto-generated master to-do list that organizes and tracks development tasks across multiple project phases such as Backend, Frontend, Ops, QA, and Docs. It assigns priorities and responsible agents to each workstream, serving as a centralized planning and coordination tool within the larger system.

This configuration file defines key paths, blueprint documents, AI models, and agent roles for the RastUp1 project environment. It centralizes settings for project structure, AI model selection, and task-specific agents, supporting orchestration of development, DevOps, and QA workflows within the larger system.

The `ops\wbs.json` file defines the Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) for the project, detailing major operational tasks such as infrastructure setup, security implementation, environment provisioning, and cost management. It organizes these tasks with unique IDs, descriptions, dependencies, assigned agents, and references to related technical blueprints, serving as a foundational planning and tracking document within the larger system's project management and DevOps workflows.

This module processes master blueprint documents by converting them to markdown, splitting them into manageable text chunks, generating concise summaries using an LLM, and creating vector embeddings for semantic indexing. It outputs a consolidated JSON index of these enriched chunks to facilitate efficient retrieval and analysis within the larger orchestrator system.

This file implements a command-line interface (CLI) for the orchestrator system, handling project initialization, configuration loading, and blueprint ingestion. It sets up the necessary directory structure and default config files within the project repository, manages interaction with large language model clients, and integrates blueprint documents into the system. Overall, it serves as the entry point for users to initialize and manage the orchestrator environment and its AI-driven components.

This file defines an LLMClient class that provides a unified interface to interact with OpenAI and optionally Anthropic large language models for embedding generation and chat completions. It encapsulates configuration and API calls, supporting OpenAI as the primary engine and Anthropic for specialized tasks like long-form summarization. This client serves as a core component in the orchestrator system to facilitate LLM-based indexing, planning, and document synthesis.

This file initializes the RastUp Orchestrator package, which serves as the central controller for ingesting and indexing blueprint documents, building the work breakdown structure (WBS) and task queue, and dispatching tasks to Cursor agents via CLI. It also manages basic state and documentation, acting as the main coordination layer within the larger system.

This file defines the Work Breakdown Structure and detailed design for a multi-role user profile system within a non-technical blueprint. It specifies how a single user account can manage multiple distinct "Service Profiles" (e.g., Model, Photographer, Videographer, Content Creator), each with role-specific data, portfolios, rates, and booking capabilities, while sharing global account elements. This structure supports clear search, booking, and navigation flows, fitting into the larger platform by organizing talent supply and role verticals for streamlined user experience and marketplace operations.

This document defines the blueprint for managing non-technical service profiles (SPs) within a platform, detailing role-specific attributes, search and discovery mechanisms, booking workflows, reviews, messaging, and portfolio management. It structures how different creative roles (e.g., models, photographers, videographers, content creators) are represented, searched, and engaged with, ensuring role-specific data indexing and user interactions. This file serves as a foundational guide for implementing and integrating non-tech service provider features into the larger system.

This document outlines the design and feature specifications for a multi-role service provider platform, focusing on media management, user interactions, verification incentives, and role-specific controls. It details how portfolios, tagging, follows, posts, verification badges, admin safety, analytics, and UX edge cases are handled to support role-based profiles and bookings. Serving as a blueprint, it guides development of a non-technical system layer that ensures role-aware user experience, content organization, and operational insights within the larger platform.

This document defines the scope, acceptance criteria, and design rationale for managing multiple non-technical user roles and service profiles within a platform, focusing on role-specific search, bookings, reviews, and verification features. It introduces new roles like "FanSubscription Creator" with content policies and age gating, and distinguishes between personal service profiles and space listings (Studios) to maintain clarity in search and booking workflows. Overall, it guides the implementation of a unified, role-anchored user experience that supports multi-role accounts while ensuring safety, transparency, and scalability.

This document defines the distinctions and relationships between Service Profiles (people/roles) and Studio Listings (places/spaces) within the system, detailing their data models, verification processes, reviews, and booking policies. It establishes how accounts can own multiple profiles and studios, how optional linking between profiles and studios works for UI display, and clarifies separate reputation and policy handling for each entity type. This blueprint ensures clear, scalable management of talent and space offerings to support precise search, booking, and reputation features in the larger platform.

This file (NT-0005.md) documents the design and user experience of a global search and filtering system for non-technical roles such as models, photographers, videographers, and content creators. It details role-specific search filters, global filters, and result card features that help buyers quickly find and book suitable professionals based on availability, budget, reliability, and relevant attributes. This blueprint fits into a larger platform aimed at connecting buyers with creative talent through an intuitive, commercially focused search and booking interface.

This document outlines a non-technical blueprint for a creator services platform, detailing features like verified social metrics integration, package and extras management, and streamlined booking workflows. It specifies how creators can connect social accounts for live, consented data display, offers tiered service packages with add-ons, and introduces tools like Instant Book, Smart Invites, and Concierge to improve booking efficiency. Overall, it supports a marketplace model that facilitates transparent, scalable collaborations between creators and buyers.

This document outlines key non-technical features and policies for a creator collaboration platform, including monetization models, collaboration contracts, audience targeting, content and NSFW guidelines, posting workflows, and user verification processes. It serves as a blueprint for platform rules, user experience design, and compliance strategies, guiding development and operational decisions within the larger system.

This document (NT-0008) outlines the design and implementation details for a non-technical blueprint focused on enhancing a booking platform with verification processes, role-specific search filters, and tiered analytics offerings. It specifies how verifications are monetized, the structure of core and pro analytics for providers, acceptance criteria for features like Instant Book and NSFW policies, and competitive advantages over similar platforms. Overall, it serves as a strategic plan to improve user trust, booking efficiency, and data-driven insights within a larger marketplace or talent booking system.

This document defines the detailed search, filtering, and booking system for non-technical service profiles (Models, Photographers, Videographers, Creators) within a talent marketplace platform. It specifies role-specific attributes, verification levels, package structures, and booking options like Instant Book to facilitate efficient talent discovery and engagement. As part of the larger system, it guides the user interface and backend logic for matching buyers with verified talent based on customizable criteria and streamlined booking workflows.

This document outlines the design and rules for non-technical features related to talent booking, social media metrics integration, content policies, and feed management within the platform. It specifies mechanisms like Instant Book, Smart Invites, and Autoaccept to streamline booking workflows, details how verified social metrics are collected and displayed, enforces NSFW and OnlyFans content guidelines, and describes a role-based, multi-tag feed system. Overall, it serves as a blueprint guiding the implementation of user interaction, content moderation, and data integration components in the larger talent marketplace system.

This document (NT-0011.md) outlines the design and implementation details for advanced social media search and filtering features within a larger system, focusing on verified and unverified social metrics across multiple platforms. It specifies how engagement metrics are computed, how platform-specific filters and toggles operate, and how trust signals and boosting integrate into search ranking and results. Overall, it serves as a blueprint for enhancing non-technical user interfaces to enable granular, trustworthy social profile searches with phased platform support.

This document defines the reputation and ranking system, search filters, and policy rules for non-technical creators and models within a platform, including eligibility criteria, promoted placement rules, and content boundaries. It details how search results are filtered and displayed—covering nudity tiers, comfort and boundary settings, fan-subscription creators, and age/policy gating—to ensure compliance and user safety. As part of the broader system, it guides search and discovery features, monetization through paid boosting, and booking workflows with enforced content and verification policies.

This document defines new search and filtering features for non-technical user roles within a platform, specifically adding support for FanSubscription Creators and Studios as searchable listing types. It details UI elements, filtering criteria, result display cards, saved search functionality, and ranking logic to enhance discovery and booking workflows. Overall, it integrates these roles into the broader talent search system while maintaining user safety and quality controls.

This document (NT-0014.md) outlines the design and acceptance criteria for integrating studio bookings into a talent marketplace platform, detailing search filters, ranking logic, and user interface elements like the "Attach a Studio" feature. It also specifies booking workflows, payment processes, and dispute handling to ensure fast, trustworthy transactions similar to Airbnb or Fiverr. Overall, it serves as a blueprint for adding studio-related functionality that complements talent search and booking within the larger system.

This document outlines the non-technical blueprint for a booking and payment system tailored to creative services, detailing buyer and provider workflows from invitation and offer selection through escrow, contract management, and payouts. It defines key processes such as private invites, contract auto-attachments, milestone-based delivery, dispute windows, and a tiered fee structure designed to balance platform revenue with user incentives. As part of a larger platform, it ensures streamlined transactions, risk management, and flexible add-ons to reduce friction and enhance trust between parties.

This document outlines the policies and workflows for non-technical aspects of a service marketplace, including post-checkout extras, travel/expense handling, rescheduling and cancellation rules, dispute resolution, contract management, anti-circumvention measures, safety protocols, and tax compliance. It defines how providers and buyers interact around bookings, payments, and conflicts, ensuring clear agreements, fair dispute processes, and regulatory adherence. This file serves as a key reference for operational procedures that support the platform’s transactional integrity and user protections.

This document (NT-0017) outlines the non-technical specifications and workflows for a booking and payout system within a service marketplace platform. It details features such as provider and buyer dashboards, notification and calendar integrations, booking modes with escrow and dispute handling, fee structures, and travel pricing policies to ensure fair, transparent, and efficient transactions. The file serves as a blueprint guiding engineering, QA, and product teams on functional requirements and rationale to improve booking conversion and user experience.

This document outlines the rules and workflows for managing travel fees, booking guardrails, and related logistics for non-technical service providers within a larger booking platform. It defines travel zones, instant booking limits, longhaul policies, and how travel costs are calculated and integrated into checkout and escrow processes. Additionally, it addresses buyer search filters, day-of transportation options, and safeguards to prevent invalid bookings, ensuring clear expectations and smooth coordination between buyers and talent.

This document outlines the platform’s policies and workflows for handling travel-related fees, payments, and escrow in bookings, including UI elements and acceptance criteria for travel arrangements. It also details the Smart Docs Engine that automates contract generation, e-signatures, and enforceability of legal paperwork required before starting a job, ensuring clarity and compliance for all parties. Overall, it integrates travel logistics and legal documentation into the booking and payment system to streamline non-technical project management.

This document (NT-0020) outlines the integration of talent and studio bookings within a platform, detailing booking types, linked booking groups, payment flows including escrow and deposits, and associated legal and safety addenda. It defines rules for booking, checkout, rescheduling, and onsite procedures to ensure smooth coordination between talent and studio services while maintaining clear policies and user rights. This file serves as a blueprint for managing combined bookings and payments in the platform’s non-technical project plans.

This document defines detailed policies and workflows for managing non-technical booking operations involving talent and studio services, including pricing adjustments, check-in/out procedures, cancellations, damage claims, payouts, taxes, and safeguards. It serves as a comprehensive blueprint to ensure consistent handling of group bookings, disputes, and edge cases within the platform’s booking and fulfillment system. The file fits into the larger system by standardizing operational rules and event tracking to support smooth coordination between buyers, hosts, and the platform.

This file documents the design and requirements for a non-technical blueprint focused on studio bookings and messaging workflows within a larger platform. It details booking lifecycle management—including pricing, deposits, check-in/out, disputes, payouts—and a role- and booking-aware messaging system that centralizes communication, collaboration, and project data. Together, these components ensure clear, fair, and scalable operations supporting studio rentals and associated user interactions.

This file documents the design and features of a non-technical messaging and project collaboration system tailored for managing bookings, inquiries, and disputes within a creative talent marketplace. It details the user interface layout, message handling (including filters, credits, and spam controls), comprehensive project panels with scheduling, briefs, deliverables, contracts, and collaborative chat actions. This blueprint serves as a guide for implementing seamless communication and project management workflows between buyers and providers in the larger platform.

This document (NT-0024) defines the specifications and guardrails for a non-technical project module focused on file handling, safety, moderation, notifications, roles, and integrations within a larger booking and collaboration system. It outlines supported file types and limits, safety features like abuse reporting and automoderation, anticircumvention measures, notification settings, and role-based permissions, ensuring secure and efficient communication and delivery between buyers, providers, and collaborators. The blueprint also details how this module ties into other system components such as booking, payments, search, and user verification to support a seamless project workflow.

This document outlines the specifications and acceptance criteria for a non-technical project management and communication system, detailing features for an MVP and a Phase 2 roadmap. It defines core functionalities like a unified inbox, project panel, action cards, file handling, safety measures, and provider-managed booking changes with audit trails, aiming to streamline booking workflows and enhance user trust. The file serves as a blueprint guiding engineering and QA teams on feature implementation and rationale within a larger platform for managing bookings and collaborations.

This document defines the rules and workflows for managing contract amendments between buyers and providers in a service booking system, including handling time, location, price changes, refunds, and fee adjustments. It specifies automated and manual approval processes, escrow and fee logic, notification updates, dispute resolution, and abuse prevention mechanisms. This ensures transparent, fair, and real-time updates to bookings while maintaining system integrity and user trust.

This document (NT-0027) defines non-technical operational procedures and system rules for managing photography/video shoot bookings, including scheduling changes, fee adjustments, and deliverable upgrades, ensuring buyer consent and accurate escrow handling. It also specifies the hybrid storage and delivery model for large media files, combining on-platform previews with off-platform original file hosting, while maintaining secure access, audit trails, and dispute resolution support. Overall, it enables providers to self-manage bookings and deliverables efficiently while protecting buyer interests and minimizing platform costs and disputes.

This document (NT-0028) defines non-technical specifications and operational rules for content delivery, provider responsibilities, and user trust & safety within the platform. It outlines manifest-based acceptance criteria for file deliveries, OAuth and API usage constraints, and detailed user verification levels to ensure secure, compliant, and transparent marketplace interactions. As part of the broader system, it supports reliable content handling and enforces safety policies to foster user confidence and reduce fraud or abuse.

This document outlines the verification, safety, moderation, and fraud prevention features for a non-technical project, detailing various user badges, safety protocols, content policies, and risk management processes. It defines how users earn trust signals, how bookings and communications are secured, and the enforcement mechanisms to maintain platform integrity. This blueprint serves as a foundational guide for implementing user trust and safety systems within the larger platform.

This document outlines a comprehensive safety and trust framework for a platform, detailing policies, operational procedures, user incentives, and technical measures to prevent fraud, abuse, and ban evasion. It defines verification tiers, enforcement protocols, evidence retention, and user-facing safety resources, as well as metrics and acceptance criteria for engineering and operations teams. This blueprint serves as a foundational guide to integrate safety, trust, and moderation features into the larger system, ensuring user protection and platform integrity.

This document defines enhancements to the platform’s trust, safety, and verification systems, including features like studio and location verification, reputation scoring, safety flags, and evidence retention for disputes. It outlines operational workflows such as triage queues, enforcement ladders, and privacy controls that support safer bookings and reduce fraud or disputes. These additions integrate with existing search and booking components to improve user confidence and platform reliability in non-technical project areas.

This document outlines the trust, safety, verification, and reputation frameworks for non-technical aspects of the platform, including user and studio identity verification, content policies, and safety enforcement measures. It defines how reputation scores and verification badges are computed and used in search filtering, details data privacy practices, and specifies rules for acceptable content and studio bookings to ensure compliance and user protection. The file fits into the larger system by supporting platform integrity, user trust, and regulatory compliance through clear policies and enforcement workflows.

This document outlines comprehensive non-technical safety, privacy, accessibility, and conduct guidelines for studio hosts and talent within a booking platform. It defines rules for onsite behavior, surveillance disclosure, hazard management, emergency procedures, anti-discrimination policies, and enforcement actions to ensure a safe and compliant environment. Serving as a blueprint, it supports platform policies and user experience by standardizing safety protocols and responsibilities across studio listings.

This document defines non-technical blueprints for user safety, verification, and support processes within a studio booking platform. It outlines lightweight preshoot safety tips, studio verification requirements, privacy and hazard policies, and a tiered enforcement system to protect users and the brand. Additionally, it specifies a multi-channel, self-serve-first support framework with guided flows and contextual help to efficiently resolve user issues while minimizing operational overhead.

This document outlines the operational procedures and ticketing taxonomy for handling non-technical support issues such as payments, payouts, rescheduling, cancellations, disputes, verification, safety incidents, refunds, and credits. It defines categories, priorities, SLAs, and workflows for managing customer and provider interactions within a larger platform support system. Additionally, it provides guidance on knowledge base structure and content standards to ensure consistent user assistance across roles and topics.

This document (NT-0036) outlines the design and operational plan for a non-technical Help Center and support system within a larger platform. It details content strategy, internal tools, automation workflows, policy playbooks, metrics tracking, accessibility/localization, and phased feature rollouts to improve user self-service, ticket handling, and support quality. The file serves as a blueprint guiding engineering and operations teams in building and maintaining an effective customer support experience integrated with booking and safety workflows.

This file documents two key non-technical blueprints: first, the design and workflow of the customer support system, including in-product help, ticketing, agent tools, safety triage, and performance dashboards; second, a structured go-to-market and city launch plan outlining market research, regulatory checks, operational fit, and KPI-driven milestones for geographic expansion. Together, these blueprints guide support operations and strategic growth within the larger system.

This document outlines the standardized city launch playbook for non-technical teams, detailing the setup of dedicated launch teams, local operations, and tailored marketing strategies. Its main responsibilities include defining KPIs, ensuring regulatory compliance, recruiting local talent, and executing localized customer acquisition to ensure consistent and scalable market entries. It fits into the larger system as a key operational blueprint guiding successful expansion into new cities.

This document outlines a localized marketing and launch strategy for introducing a product or service into new cities. It details a mix of geo-targeted digital advertising, community engagement, local partnerships, and iterative customer acquisition tactics tailored to each city's unique culture. As part of a broader go-to-market plan, it guides teams through phased launch milestones to build early user adoption and establish strong local brand presence.

This document outlines a phased, milestone-driven city launch plan for expanding services into new locations, detailing pre-launch preparation, launch execution, and knowledge transfer to local teams. It establishes clear timelines, key activities, and success metrics to ensure disciplined rollouts and smooth transitions to local operational control. Additionally, it describes post-launch monitoring and scaling strategies to support ongoing growth and maintain quality across launched cities within the larger expansion system.

This document outlines a structured post-launch review and expansion strategy for city-based operations, focusing on tracking KPIs, maintaining quality standards, and fostering knowledge sharing across city teams. It emphasizes sustainable, phased growth by evaluating each city's performance before scaling further, while promoting cross-city collaboration and continuous improvement. This blueprint supports consistent service delivery and operational excellence as part of the broader go-to-market rollout plan.

This document outlines a phased city expansion plan for launching and scaling a core service in multiple markets, detailing milestone-driven goals and success metrics for each phase. It defines a tiered rollout strategy with tailored KPIs based on market maturity, and emphasizes continuous monitoring and iterative improvement to ensure sustainable growth. As part of the broader non-technical project blueprints, it guides strategic decision-making for market entry and scaling efforts.

This document outlines a dynamic city launch playbook for non-technical teams, detailing key performance metrics, iterative strategies, and best practices for expanding service markets sustainably. It serves as a living guide to track supply and demand, customer engagement, unit economics, and cross-city learnings to optimize growth and market leadership. Positioned within the larger system, it supports coordinated, data-driven market launches and continuous improvement across multiple cities.

This file outlines the launch strategy and scope for integrating a curated "Verified Studios (Lite)" marketplace within a talent discovery and booking platform, focusing on photo/video shoot spaces as a complementary add-on rather than a full venue marketplace. It details MVP features such as studio discovery, booking mechanics, verification, and payment policies, while deferring complex functionalities like insurance and multi-city expansion until after product-market fit. Overall, it guides how studios enhance conversion and user experience without competing directly with established venue platforms.

This document outlines the strategy and implementation plan for integrating creative studio spaces ("Verified Studios") into a talent booking platform, focusing on supply seeding, demand generation, user experience, and monetization mechanics. It defines key features like studio add-ons, booking policies, verification flows, and KPIs to measure success, ensuring studios complement rather than distract from the core talent marketplace. The file serves as a blueprint for launching and scaling the studio booking functionality within the larger system.

This document defines the platform's fee structure, including provider commissions, buyer service fees, discounts, and refund policies, benchmarking them against competitors to ensure competitive yet sustainable economics. It also outlines payment processing details, escrow and payout timing, and examples to align Finance and Product teams on fee calculations. Overall, it serves as a key reference for monetization strategy within the larger marketplace system.

This document (NT-0047) defines the platform's fee structure, pricing transparency rules, and related policies for buyer and provider transactions. It details fee calculations, discounts, refund rules, payout timing, and anti-leakage incentives, ensuring clear communication and sustainable economics within the marketplace. As part of the non-technical blueprints, it guides product and operations teams on implementing and managing platform fees and user experience around payments.

This document outlines detailed pricing, fee structures, and policies for studio bookings within the platform, including provider and buyer fees, discounts, refunds, and handling of linked bookings combining talent and studio services. It serves as an addendum to core monetization mechanics, ensuring clarity and consistency in how fees are applied and managed for non-technical stakeholders. This file fits into the larger system by defining non-technical policy and pricing guidelines that support platform revenue and user experience for studio-related transactions.

This document defines the detailed fee structure, payment processing assumptions, and refund policies for studio bookings within the platform, including worked examples and special cases like chargebacks and deposits. It ensures transparent, predictable economics for buyers and hosts, integrates with broader booking and monetization systems, and supports scalable operations through clear ledger and receipt management. Overall, it serves as a key reference for implementing and managing non-technical financial rules related to studio transactions in the platform.

This document outlines the pricing, tier structure, and monetization strategy for a non-technical platform focused on service bookings, emphasizing fairness, trust, and gradual monetization. It details free features at launch, earned trust perks, and optional usage-based paid add-ons designed to encourage early adoption and platform liquidity before introducing subscription tiers. The file fits into the larger system as a blueprint guiding the platform’s business model, user incentives, and feature access policies.

This document (NT-0051) outlines the non-technical blueprint for the platform’s launch strategy, focusing on user incentives, feature gating, and economic models to drive adoption and growth. It defines storage tiers, messaging credit systems, fairness and ranking rules, launch promotions, and criteria for introducing a paid Pro plan, all designed to balance user experience, trust, and profitability. The file fits into the larger system as a strategic guide ensuring aligned incentives, scalable trust mechanisms, and measurable success metrics for the platform’s initial rollout and future monetization.

This document outlines the design and pilot plan for a paid boosting and promotion system aimed at non-technical service providers, detailing pricing, eligibility, placement rules, and fairness guardrails. It ensures paid visibility supplements but does not replace organic search results, with strict caps and transparency to maintain trust and platform quality. As part of a larger platform, it pilots in Houston to incrementally increase bookings and revenue while safeguarding user experience and organic relevance.

This document outlines the design and operational plan for a pilot paid promotion system ("Boost") targeting non-technical providers and buyers in select cities. It details provider setup, buyer experience, fraud and safety controls, performance KPIs, pricing governance, and launch strategy to ensure fairness, transparency, and ecosystem health. The file serves as a blueprint guiding the implementation and monitoring of this advertising feature within a larger marketplace platform.

This document (NT-0054) outlines the design and acceptance criteria for a non-technical project focused on monetization and verification processes within a platform. It defines guardrails and policies for paid search boosts and featured listings to ensure quality, fairness, and safety, while also detailing a tiered, automation-first verification system to build trust and enable key platform features. The file serves as a blueprint guiding implementation and compliance strategies to balance growth, user experience, and risk management in the larger system.

This document (NT-0055) outlines a multi-tiered user verification and background check system for a platform, detailing processes for identity verification, background screening, and studio/location validation to unlock badges and platform features. It covers user experience flows, cost and monetization strategies, operational models including automation and manual review, as well as compliance with legal and data privacy standards. This blueprint serves as a key component in the platform’s trust and safety infrastructure, enabling secure user interactions and eligibility gating within the larger system.

This document outlines the design and implementation plan for a multi-phase verification system within a marketplace platform, focusing on identity, background, and studio verification to build trust and ensure compliance. It details verification workflows, incentives, KPIs, pricing, and operational guardrails to balance user experience, cost control, and growth scalability. The file serves as a blueprint guiding product, engineering, and operations teams in deploying and tuning verification features that enhance booking confidence and platform safety.

This file outlines the NT-0057 blueprint for a non-technical system enabling buyers (brands, agencies, studios, creators) to efficiently create briefs, invite providers, compare proposals, and award jobs with integrated escrow and e-signature workflows. It defines user personas, key features like Smart Invite and RFP Broadcast, proposal handling, and delivery management, emphasizing speed, trust, fairness, and usage-based monetization. This blueprint fits into a larger platform facilitating streamlined, secure, and transparent project sourcing and fulfillment without subscription barriers.

This document outlines a comprehensive non-technical project blueprint detailing workflows for awarding services, document management with e-signatures, delivery verification, acceptance and revision processes, promotional deliverables enforcement, attendance and dispute resolution, collaboration tools, and concierge support. It defines system behaviors such as escrow handling, automated checks, buyer/provider interactions, and compliance monitoring, serving as a key reference for implementing and coordinating various operational modules within a larger service delivery platform.

This document outlines the design and operational plan for a non-technical platform module focused on managing buyer-seller interactions, including scheduling, privacy controls, payment verification, and content safety. It details features like Smart Invites, RFP broadcasts, escrow and contract integrations, analytics dashboards, and quality KPIs to ensure trust, efficiency, and dispute reduction. Serving as a blueprint, it guides the implementation of core workflows and user roles within a larger talent sourcing and project management system.

This document (NT-0060) outlines the design and workflow specifications for non-technical seller tools and processes within a larger platform, focusing on roles like Models, Photographers, Videographers, and Creators. It details features such as onboarding wizards, package templates, trust and verification mechanisms, and dispute prevention strategies to streamline job booking, delivery, and payouts. The file fits into the system by defining how sellers interact with the platform to create clear, scalable, and trust-based service profiles that integrate with analytics, escrow, and project management components.

This document defines standardized package templates, pricing controls, calendar management, messaging workflows, and smart contract clauses for non-technical seller roles (e.g., photographers, videographers, models, creators) on a service marketplace platform. It ensures consistent quoting, availability handling, lead pipeline management, and policy enforcement to streamline booking, pricing, and delivery processes. Overall, it supports seller operations and buyer interactions within the larger platform ecosystem.

This document (NT-0062) outlines detailed non-technical project plans and feature specifications for a digital marketplace platform, covering seller workflows such as licensing, delivery, proofing, portfolio management, reputation scoring, payouts, analytics, team collaboration, mobile essentials, and key performance indicators. It serves as a comprehensive blueprint guiding the development and operational standards for seller-side functionality and performance metrics within the larger system.

This document outlines the acceptance criteria and detailed feature specifications for a non-technical project focused on seller onboarding, package templates, delivery workflows, and reputation management within a marketplace platform. It defines tools and processes such as onboarding wizards, pricing intelligence, smart document handling, delivery manifests, and verification steps designed to reduce friction, improve trust, and control costs. As part of the larger system, it supports seller-side workflows and quality assurance to enhance booking efficiency, dispute reduction, and marketplace trustworthiness.

This document outlines the design and acceptance criteria for a role-specific review, reputation, and incentive system within a platform that facilitates bookings between creators and buyers. It defines how verified, fair, and role-aware feedback is collected, structured, and displayed to build trust and reward reliability without enabling review manipulation. The system integrates with onboarding, booking completion, and profile/search displays to enhance transparency and encourage professional conduct across the platform.

This document defines the design and rules for a reputation and incentive system within a platform, detailing how reputation scores for buyers and providers are computed, decayed, and protected against gaming. It specifies components like reputation inputs, behavior-shaping incentives, anti-abuse moderation policies, and visibility of buyer reputation to providers. This system supports trust, ranking, and privilege gating in the larger marketplace or collaboration platform.

This document defines the design and operational details of the Buyer/Brand Reputation system within a marketplace platform, outlining how buyer reputation scores are calculated, displayed to providers, and integrated into search ranking, access controls, and feature gating. It specifies review processes, moderation policies, incentives, KPIs, and analytics to ensure trust, fairness, and behavior improvement, thereby supporting user retention and growth loops. Overall, it serves as a blueprint for managing buyer reputation to enhance platform trust and engagement.

This document outlines the design principles, user lifecycle stages, key health metrics, and core engagement loops for a non-technical platform connecting buyers and sellers (e.g., models, photographers, creators). It details how various feedback and trust-building loops—such as booking, reviews, tagging, content sharing, and verification—work together to drive user retention, growth, and fair visibility without paywalls. As part of the broader system, it guides product and growth strategies to foster crossside interactions, reinforce trust, and maintain user safety and satisfaction.

This document outlines a comprehensive feature blueprint for a non-technical system focused on user engagement, retention, and referral mechanisms within a marketplace platform. It details functionalities such as verification and trust-building loops, tailored retention features for buyers and sellers, referral credit systems with fraud prevention, notification management, and user activity feeds. Overall, it serves as a strategic plan to enhance platform interaction, booking rates, and user loyalty through targeted incentives and communication workflows.

This document (NT-0069) outlines detailed project plans and acceptance criteria for non-technical features related to user engagement, referral systems, saved searches, feeds, and winback flows within a platform. It defines key experiments, KPIs, and support processes aimed at improving activation, retention, safety, and cost efficiency, while ensuring transparent, evidence-based dispute resolution and user support. As part of the larger system, it guides product development and operational policies to enhance user experience and trust across buyer and seller interactions.

This document outlines the non-technical operational policies and workflows for customer support, dispute resolution, safety enforcement, and payment handling within the platform. It details service level agreements, self-service options, refund and adjustment rules, chargeback management, safety incident responses, and knowledge base structure, serving as a comprehensive guide for support agents and internal tools. As part of the larger system, it ensures consistent, efficient handling of user issues and policy enforcement to maintain platform trust and compliance.

This document (NT-0071) outlines detailed policies, workflows, and acceptance criteria for non-technical support processes related to refunds, disputes, safety, and account controls within a larger service platform. It defines self-service flows, refund matrices, evidence handling, staffing SLAs, and key metrics to ensure fair, scalable, and trust-preserving resolution outcomes across different booking types (e.g., Studios, Linked Booking Groups).
